results.title: Parting shots from animals
results.creator_credit: Michael Dibb, Christopher Rawlence and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Omnibus”.
Based on essays by John Berger, the film looks at how man’s exploitation of animals has affected himself. From a variety of locations ranging from circuses to slaughterhouses, the evolution of man’s attitude to animals is traced.

results.title: Parties
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Children’s birthdays can be a pleasure or a disaster. PGR speaks with two mothers, seasoned party givers, on how to plan a successful party. The questions of where to hold a successful party. The questions of where to hold the party - indoors/outdoors, guests, duration, safety, food, and possible plans for entertainment to offer the children, are discussed. Encouraging the children to paint a table cloth and how to make party hats and invitations introduces some novel ideas. An excellent tape for parents wanting to ensure their children’s birthday parties are happy and successful events.

results.title: Participation for all (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Burbank Audio Visual and Ian Andrews
results.brief_description: Describes an elementary school program for all grade levels, how to develop student leadership, and ways of modifying a variety of indoor and outdoor activities to maximise the use of all available space and equipment.

results.title: Participation and equity program
results.brief_description: Outlines the philosophy behind the Participation and Equity Program and provides an overview of the ways in which some schools throughout Australia are implementing programs that are attempting to come to terms with overcoming barriers to effective participation by students in education. Changes in curriculum, school research community groups, and the teaching of English as a second language are just some of the methods outlined. No other credits.

results.title: Partenaires = Partners
results.brief_description:
Marion is a famous actress of the popular theatre who owes her success to her husband, Gabriel, a bitter and alcoholic has-been. This unbalance in their respective fortune is driving their relationship to an end. Everynight, in the changing rooms of the theatre, the two actors engage in a cruel verbal and emotional ‘duel’.

Credits: Producer, Henry Lange ; director, Claude d’Anna ; writers, Laure Bonin, Claude d’Anna ; photography, Pierre Dupouey ; music, Richard Henberger, Egisto Macchi.
Cast: Nicole Garcia, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Michel Galabru, Michel Duchaussoy, Elisa Servier, Jenny Cleves.

results.title: Part time parent, full time job
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Dick Foster and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Parents and Children”.
Society expects parents to be both workers and up-bringers. Two societies have made conscious attempts to resolve the conflict between the world of work and the family - Sweden and the Israeli Kibbutz.

results.title: Part time
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student fo rthe 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A short documentary depicting four secondary students’ part time job (bakery, sales/retail, supermarket and gymnastics instructor). Questions such as how much does one earn, how they got the job and how they spend their money are all investigated.

results.title: Part of the community
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Joe Reeve who is in a wheel chair as a result of an industrial accident.
